special_functions package¶

Submodules¶

special_functions.besselk module¶

special_functions.besselk.py_besselk()¶

Computes Bessel function or its derivative, \(\partial K_{\nu}(z) / \partial z\). This function is the pythonic interface of this module and is called by :funct:`besselk.wrapper.py_besselk`. For the cythonic interface, see besselk() function.

Example:

This example compute Bessel function \(K_{\nu}(z)\) and its first and second derivatives for a complex argument. Note, this function uses the global lock interpreter (gil).

>>> # import module in a *.py file
>>> from special_functions import besselk

>>> # Declare typed variables
>>> nu = 2.5
>>> z = 1+2j

>>> d0k = besselk(nu, z)      # no derivative
>>> d1k = besselk(nu, z, 1)    # 1st derivative
>>> d2k = besselk(nu, z, 2)    # 2nd derivative

special_functions.besselk module¶

special_functions.besselk.py_besselk()¶

Computes Bessel function or its derivative, \(\partial K_{\nu}(z) / \partial z\). This function is the pythonic interface of this module and is called by :funct:`besselk.wrapper.py_besselk`. For the cythonic interface, see besselk() function.

Example:

This example compute Bessel function \(K_{\nu}(z)\) and its first and second derivatives for a complex argument. Note, this function uses the global lock interpreter (gil).

>>> # import module in a *.py file
>>> from special_functions import besselk

>>> # Declare typed variables
>>> nu = 2.5
>>> z = 1+2j

>>> d0k = besselk(nu, z)      # no derivative
>>> d1k = besselk(nu, z, 1)    # 1st derivative
>>> d2k = besselk(nu, z, 2)    # 2nd derivative
